caption.p: Effect of CO 2 and temperature on the growth of a liana and its host. (a) Quercus cerris growth (measured as squared rooted basal area increment) showed a strong interactive response to atmospheric CO 2 concentration and temperature, where CO 2 increased growth in cool years but decreased it in hot years. (b) By contrast, Hedera helix grew better with increased CO 2 under almost all temperature conditions. Predictions are shown for temperatures within the 95% quantile range
